sec.p: Service climate refers to employees’ perceptions of practices, procedures, and behaviors that are expected, rewarded, and supported with regard to customer service and customer service quality. To assess service climate, we used eight items adapted from Schneider and colleagues’ service climate measure (α = .91) [ 53]. Items were modified to apply specifically to a SUD service setting. All service climate items were scored on a 0 (“poor”) to 4 (“excellent”) scale.
